page.title: 20CLOPHILL-TOURISM
page.content: The oldest place of interest is the remains of{Cainhoe Castle.}There is little to be seen but the earth works of a{Saxon Fort.}Probably there was just a wooden structure with a{motte and{bailey. We have a ruined{12c Church.}It was used for special services until the 1950s but after the roof lead was stolen it fell into disrepair. It has now been made into a{picnic area. The proposed{Greensand Ridge Walk will pass through our area. This is a {long distance footpath}between{Sandy}& {Leighton Buzzard.}There is a small {campsite}with minimum facilities at Kiln Farm on the route. There are{5 Public Houses}which all provide food. One has an old{Lock-up & {Pound}in the grounds. In the late summer several{gardens are open to the public for{charity.
